text:
Question 92) Pressure pans reduce the cooking time of food by raising the boiling temperature of the water. Knowing users of the utensil usually lower the intensity of fire in pressure pans after they start out the vapors.
When lowering the fire, the flame reduces, as this is avoided the
A) Increased internal pressure and the risk of explosion.
B) pan dilation and disconnect with its lid.
C) Loss of nutrient food quality.
D) deformation of sealing rubber.
E) unnecessary gas consumption.
